data.text: @LynyrdoV @contrarian4data @ianmSC  Also, aerosols are not stopped that way. And when we take off the masks to eat, any effectiveness is gone. Schools which were completely open all this time with no masks did about the same as highly masked or even kids out in the community. Most cases trace to home.
@LynyrdoV @contrarian4data The real world data across counties, states, regions and countries do no show that. Look at Ian Miller’s posts. He graphs it out nicely.

@StevePesce12 @contrarian4data Minor quibble. Social distancing/school closures/capacity limits do slow spread. But as soon as you STOP doing them, you will get all the cases you avoided before, so they're useless in the end. People argue past each other because they don't acknowledge this dynamic.
@contrarian4data I'm not genius, but I'm guessing FL has a much higher older demographic.

@contrarian4data COVID POLICY REPORT CARD:
Vax stopping spread- virtually zero
Prevent severe outcomes- fades to zero
Masks- zero
Social Distancing- zero
Scrubbing surfaces- zero
Plexiglass- zero
Mandates & Passport- zero
Travel ban- zero
Capacity limits- zero
Curfews- zero
School Closures- zero
@contrarian4data But why should people with natural immunity get vaxxed? Two doses? Boosters? Boys 12-17 get boosters? Even if they have natural immunity? This is insanity!

He thinks "The Experts™️" are going to have his back.

https://t.co/6m3R5P6dES
